conclusion: Analyze how shadows A, B, C, and D will change when the light source moves to different positions.
A blue alarm clock casting shadow A.
An egg casting shadow B.
A small dark object casting shadow C.
A white electronic device casting shadow D.
Shadows move in the opposite direction from the light source.
Shadow size increases when the light source gets closer to the object.
Shadow size decreases when the light source moves farther from the object.
Shadow elongates when the light source is positioned at a lower angle.
Shadow A will move toward the front right and likely increase in length as the light creates a more oblique angle.
Shadow B will move toward the front right and may slightly increase in size.
Shadow C will move toward the front right and increase in length similar to shadow A.
Shadow D will move toward the front right and increase in length, creating a more elongated shadow.
Shadow A will move toward the front left and increase in length similar to the first case.
Shadow B will move toward the front left and slightly increase in size.
Shadow C will move toward the front left and increase in length.
Shadow D will move toward the front left and increase in length, with potential distortion.
All shadows will move opposite to the light movement and increase in length/size.
The shape of each shadow will distort based on the object's geometry.
Rounder objects like the egg will have more gradual changes.
Taller objects like the alarm clock will have more dramatic elongation.
The rectangular controller will show increased distortion based on its orientation.
